TD1488-d-04-19-88-RFP.Narrative: AT 1:50PM,TUESDAY APRIL 19, 1988, AS RF&P TRAIN NO.175 ENTERED ACCA YARD ON #2 MAIN TRACK, A DERAILMENT OCCURRED INVOLVING ITS LOCOMOTIVES RF&P 127, 122, 126, AND THE FOLLOWING TWO RAIL CARS: TTWX 980366 AND TTWX 979791. WHEN THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED, THE FUEL TANK OF ALL THREE LOCOMOTIVES WERE RUPTURED. HENRICO COUNTY FIRE DEPART. WAS NOTIFIED IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE DERAILMENT AND ARRIVED ON THE SCENE AT APPROXIMATELY 2:00PM TO CONTAIN THE FUEL OIL LEAKS AND PREVENT FIRE. VIRGINIA STATE WATER CONTROL BOARD WAS NOTIFIED AND RESPONDED TO THE SCENE. RF&P EMPLOYEES AND ESI ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES HANDLED CLEAN UP OF THE FUEL OIL SPILL. THERE WAS EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO THE LOCOMOTIVES AND MINOR DAMAGETO THE TTWX CARS. THERE WAS ALSO EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO THE TRACK AND SIGNAL APPLIANCES. THERE WERE NOPERSONAL INJURIES.THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED WHEN THE NO.4 AXLE ON RF&P LOCOMOTIVE 122 BROKE ACCOUNT OF OVERHEATED TRACTION MOTOR SUPPORT BEARING.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

288-d-04-02-88-PATH.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 10:47AM THE MOTORMAN ON THE 10:37 PM JOURNAL SQUARE TO 33RD STREET TRAIN (CARS IN CONSIST 625-179-801-608-856-860-661) REPOTED THAT HE LOST THE MOTORMAN'S INDICATION AND THAT HE HAD NO CONTROLLER POWER. THE TRAIN, OPERATING FROM CAR 625, WAS BETWEEN CAISSON NUMBER THREE AND CAISSONONE AT SIGNAL #502. THE MOTORMAN CHANGED POSITION BUT STILL COULD NOT GET CONTROLLER POWER OR GET HIS INDICATION. HE THEN REPORTED THAT ONE OF THE CARS IN THE TRAIN HAD DERAILED. AFTER REVIEWING THE TRACK AREA AT THE LOCATION OF THE DERAILMENT AND AFTER EXAMINING THE EQUIPMENT INVOLVED (CARS 801 & 608) IT IS THE CONCLUSION OF PATH'S STAFF THAT THE DERAILMENT RESULTED FROM A STIFF TRUCK ON PA-4 CAR801. THIS CONCLUSION WAS BRIEFLY DISCUSSED WITH J.J. RYAN, MANAGER OF THE FRA OFFICE AT NEWARK, NEWJERSEY ON APRIL 4, 1988. ON THE FOLLOWING DAY, HE SENT FRA INSPECTOR, JIM LOFTUS TO EXAMINE CAR 801WITH SPECIFIC REFERENCE TO THE TRUCK INVOLVED. INSPECTOR LOFTUS AGREED WITH PATH'S CONCLUSION THATTHE TRUCK WAS THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT.NoneNoneNoneNone
